sn35.233:4.1: At one time Venerables Ānanda and Kāmabhū were staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
sn35.233:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Kāmabhū came out of solitude, went to Venerable Ānanda,
sn35.233:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn35.233:5.1: “Reverend Ānanda, which is it? Is the eye the fetter of sights, or are sights the fetter of the eye?
sn35.233:5.2: Is the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.233:5.3: mind the fetter of phenomena, or are phenomena the fetter of the mind?”
sn35.233:6.1: “Reverend Kāmabhū, the eye is not the fetter of sights, nor are sights the fetter of the eye.
sn35.233:6.2: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.
sn35.233:6.4: mind is not the fetter of phenomena, nor are phenomena the fetter of the mind.
sn35.233:6.5: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.
sn35.233:7.1: Suppose there was a black ox and a white ox yoked by a single harness or yoke.
sn35.233:7.2: Would it be right to say that
sn35.233:7.3: the black ox is the yoke of the white ox, or the white ox is the yoke of the black ox?”
sn35.233:7.5: The black ox is not the yoke of the white ox, nor is the white ox the yoke of the black ox.
sn35.233:7.6: The yoke there is the single harness or yoke that they’re yoked by.”
sn35.233:7.7: “In the same way, the eye is not the fetter of sights, nor are sights the fetter of the eye.
sn35.233:7.9: mind is not the fetter of phenomena, nor are phenomena the fetter of the mind.
sn35.233:7.10: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.”
